title-group.subtitle: From Physical Science to Military Science

bio.p: Dr Michael Lauren is a Research Leader in the Human Systems Group for the Defence Technology Agency, New Zealand. He has a PhD in physics from the University of Auckland. Dr Lauren is one of the original developers of the MANA agent-based combat model.

Dr Gregory McIntosh works with the Operations Analysis section at Defence Technology Agency in New Zealand where his recent work has focused on developing the MANA agent-based model for combat simulation. He has a PhD in physics from Victoria University in Wellington.

Professor Jim Moffat is a Senior Fellow of the Defence Science and Technology Laboratory, UK, and a Fellow of both the Operational Research Society, and the Institute of Mathematics and its Applications. He has worked for the past 30 years on defence related operational analysis problems, and aerospace technology research. His most recent works include the Dept of Defense CCRP publications “Complexity Theory and Network Centric Warfare‚” and “The Agile Organisation.”
